source.name: Cross-Chain NFT Interoperability
source.instructions: Which of the following scenarios best represents a use case for cross-chain NFT interoperability?

answers.answer: Transferring an Ethereum-based NFT to a Solana marketplace for listing and sale
Minting a new NFT collection on the Ethereum blockchain
Storing NFT metadata on a decentralized storage network
Creating a smart contract for an NFT drop on a single blockchain
Viewing an NFT in a web3 wallet connected to its native blockchain

source.guidance: The correct answer is "Transferring an Ethereum-based NFT to a Solana marketplace for listing and sale." This scenario demonstrates cross-chain NFT interoperability as it involves moving a non-fungible token from one blockchain (Ethereum) to another (Solana) for cross-chain utility and commerce. The other options do not involve interaction between different blockchain networks: minting NFTs, storing metadata, creating smart contracts, and viewing NFTs in wallets can all occur within a single blockchain ecosystem. This question tests the student's ability to recognize practical applications of blockchain interoperability specifically in the context of cross-chain NFT transfers and marketplace interactions.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT identify practical applications of cross-chain NFT interoperability
